ygData.subject: RE: Hey this sounded interesting..
ygData.msgSnippet: true but it has obviously been a small percentage of your actual playing time as evidenced by your levels.  Your lowest level character probably has more
ygData.messageBody:
true but it has obviously been a small percentage of your actual playing
time as evidenced by your levels. Your lowest level character probably has
more playing time than my highest. Dying for me doesn't just mean running
across some zones and back to playing. It often means running across some
zones and quitting for the night. Might as well be like that old MUD
Immortal where dying prevented you from playing till the next day. Now that
would be a painful penalty for many people, but for me no different really
than the current one.

-----Original Message-----
From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
[mailto:Michael.Garramone@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 30, 1999 5:34 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>

i've completely lost where this discussion is going. i advocate the
non-binding side of the discussion, meaning for me when i die i have less
time to as you say gain levels and exp, but that means that's all i care
about? i don't think dying is fun, i don't think running naked is fun.
it's not supposed to be, that is my point. apparently dying is such a
traumatizing experience for you. running across a few zones is an
incredible hardship. i've done it a million times, and i still don't want
to be able to bind.

Shada

> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Definitely Agreed! Still I can't figure out why people think
> running naked
> accross the world to you body is more fun than regaining exp
> you had fun
> getting the first time just so you don't get set back in some
> bizarre got to
> get to the next level plan. What's up with that? Does
> anyone understand
> that at all and can explain it logically? I mean you had fun
> getting those
> xp the first time. You get to get them all over again and
> have fun again?
> Unless you let thsi get out of control by not taking
> unreasonable risks,
> wait I thought that was the whole point of a death penalty?,
> there shouldn't
> be a problem. Unless of course playing isn't fun, only going
> up levels is
> fun. Of course at that point running naked to get your
> corpse still isn't
> fun because while you are doing that you aren't going up levels.
